etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Ernest Bax (1854–1926), Marxist theoretician and activist. From ancient Greek Πολιαδ-, Πολιάς (female) guardian of the city, epithet of Athene as tutelary goddess of Athens (from πόλις city + -άς) + -ic

definitions: Of the nature of or relating to a tutelary god of a city or state.
